As a member of the Placement Committee, I was responsible for managing end-to-end placement preparedness, logistics, and coordination for a cohort of over 1,000 students and engagements with 200+ recruiting organizations across diverse industries. This role honed my ability to manage large-scale, high-stakes processes with precision and agility.

  • I developed strong communication and stakeholder management skills, enabling me to effectively engage with students, corporate recruiters, alumni, and internal teams. By understanding the unique needs of both students and hiring organizations, I ensured clear, timely, and professional exchanges that contributed to a smooth placement process.

  • My role demanded robust organizational and time management capabilities, as I balanced multiple tasks such as interview scheduling, resume screening, offer tracking, and document management—all while adhering to strict deadlines and maintaining process integrity.

  • I also actively contributed to network building and relationship management by connecting with recruiters, alumni, and industry leaders to expand the placement network, creating valuable career opportunities for the student community.

  • Throughout this experience, I applied problem-solving and decision-making skills to resolve last-minute challenges—such as interview rescheduling, candidate shortlist disputes, or employer-specific requirements—while ensuring optimal outcomes for all stakeholders involved.

  • Overall, this role sharpened my ability to operate at the intersection of people, process, and strategy, a skill set I continue to leverage in my career across Product Management, Project Delivery, and AI Consulting engagements.
